quiz.question: Which Roman god's name is the source of the English day name 'Saturday'?

Which mechanism explains irregular past forms like 'dove' appearing alongside 'dived'?
Which mythological figure inspired the English word 'panic'?
What is the linguistic term for a word-by-word translation like 'skyscraper' into another language?
What term describes a single root developing multiple related senses over time?
What does the Old English root in 'breakfast' literally mean?
What term describes a brand name becoming a common noun, like 'thermos'?
The Finnic languages, including Finnish and Estonian, belong to which family?
Which language is the immediate source of the English word 'kiosk'?
Which English occupational title derives from Latin 'magister' meaning teacher or master?
Which ancient language provided the primary lexical source for medieval church and law vocabulary?
